main event: On September 6, 1957, in Washington, D.C., a ground-radar observation reported an unidentified flying object moving to the north for five minutes, with a brief summary suggesting the object was the size of a lamp.
interesting points: The report suggested the object could be a possible balloon or astronomical phenomena.
The physical characteristics of the object included a bright white light, high-speed movement, and a faded out appearance.
The observation was made by Major James E. Dentino of the USAF.
The object was described as large, rectangular, curved, and metallic, with no smoke or exhaust.
The object traveled at tremendous speed and disappeared from sight to the south while being visually observed from the ground.
witnesses: Major James E. Dentino and other unidentified observers
